Title: CAD Design
Content: A lot of my projects require 3D printing, which requires CAD design. I have a little experience in Fusion360 but I switched to Onshape recently.

Title: 3D Printing
Content: I'm sort of a novice when it comes to the settings you can mess with, but I do have experience maintaining and repairing 3D printers.

Title: Robotics
Content: By robotics I mean using microcontrollers to control other devices, but I have made actual robots too.

Title: Soldering
Content: I have gotten pretty good at soldering from my robotics tinkering, and I can now make pretty neat joints.

Title: Project Tracking
Content: With all the projects I have made, I usually set up a Trello board to track my progress, and I have been able to make them highly organized over time.

Title: Programming in Lua
Content: Lua was one of my very first languages, and it was simple enough to teach me most main components of programming.

Title: Programming in C#
Content: C# is one of my more recently learned languages, but I have used it for over 4 years now modding/making applications and modding games.

Title: Programming in C++
Content: The dreaded complex programming language, which I unfortunutely have to use for microcontrollers. I don't mind it now though, it's gotten easier.

Title: Programming in Python
Content: I used Python mainly for data, from parsing through text files to analyzing images to detect movement.

Title: Programming in Java
Content: Java is similar to C# in a lot of ways except for the fact that C# with .NET has a nicer framework to it.

Title: Programming in HTML/CSS
Content: I took a web-dev class in my Sophomore year of highschool which is where I started making websites like this.
